definition: to shake up/to deal a shock/(fig.) to stir (sb's heart)
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: Brands, once established, are not easily shaken.
sentences.chinese: 品牌一旦建立就不易撼動。

sentences.english: It was earth-shaking in its day and continues to be so today.
sentences.chinese: 自它誕生那天，它便撼動了地球，並延續到了今天。

sentences.english: Freefalling demand for cars has sent shock waves throughout Japan's auto industry.
sentences.chinese: 自由落地般的需求下跌撼動了日本汽車工業。

sentences.english: And when the time is right, the betrayer will become, the betrayed.
sentences.chinese: 但是，背叛者伊利丹的到來撼動了他對外域的統治。

sentences.english: Shake all ingredients with ice and strain into chilled martini glass .
sentences.chinese: 撼動所有成分與冰和應變到冰鮮馬提尼玻璃。

sentences.english: Seconds later, a tremendous blast shook lower Manhattan.
sentences.chinese: 頃刻間，一場足以撼動曼哈頓的爆炸就響起。

sentences.english: Hope that all the English teacher kalk with English on computer.
sentences.chinese: 決心和恆心撼動世界希望我們英語教師多用英語交流。

sentences.english: This Polish composer's beautiful piano music plays to the heart.
sentences.chinese: 這位波蘭作曲家的優美琴音撼動人心。

sentences.english: However, the arrival of Illidan the Betrayer shake his rule of the external domain.
sentences.chinese: 但是，背叛者伊利丹的到來撼動了他對外域的統治。

sentences.english: She is crying not, but still can not shake his heart of stone.
sentences.chinese: 她哭鬧不依，卻仍無法撼動他的鐵石心腸。

sentences.english: I found for the first time that the most beautiful thing is the poweful shock to the heart.
sentences.chinese: 第一次發現，原來最美麗的就是對於心靈的撼動。

sentences.english: Even a water gun can shake its foundations?' writes a reveler named Ashkan on his Facebook page.
sentences.chinese: 一隻水槍竟能撼動它的根基？

sentences.english: In 1477, the Onin War let the fall of the old shogun.
sentences.chinese: 1477年的應仁之亂撼動了古老的幕府統治。

definition: to sway/to waver/to rock/to rattle/to destabilize/to pose a challenge to
to touch/to stir up (trouble or emotions)/to move (sb's emotions or worry)
axle/(fig.) central element/key element/axis (alliance of nations)
to affect/to produce a change in sth
to attack/to batter/(of waves) to pound against/shock/impact
to discuss two disparate things together (idiom); to mention on equal terms/to place on a par with/(often with negatives: impossible to mention X in the same breath as Y)
to have a clear conscience/to feel no qualms
